sentences.text: DEAR STOCKHOLDERS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting of Stockholders on Tuesday, April 25, 2017 at 10 a.m., at the Tampa Marriott Waterside Hotel & Marina, Tampa, Florida.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to present to you our nominees for the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Joan E. Spero is not a nominee for election, and her term on the Board will end in April.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are very grateful to her for her many valuable contributions and will miss her participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this years Annual Meeting, you will once again be asked to provide an advisory vote on executive compensation, as well as on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation, which is required to be voted on every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards recommendations on these items are set forth in the proposal, and your support is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record can vote their shares by using the Internet or the telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for using these convenient services are set forth on the proxy card or the notice of Internet availability of proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received your materials by mail, you also may vote your shares by marking your votes on the enclosed proxy card, signing and dating it, and mailing it in the enclosed envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you will need special assistance at the meeting because of a disability, please contact the Office of the Secretary, International Business Machines Corporation, 1 New Orchard Road, Armonk, NY 10504.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Very truly yours,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Virginia M. Rometty Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS IMPORTANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote by using the Internet, the telephone, or by signing, dating, and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Stockholders of International Business Machines Corporation will be held on Tuesday, April 25, 2017 at 10 a.m., at the Tampa Marriott Waterside Hotel & Marina, 700 South Florida Avenue, Tampa, Florida 33602.

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs Board of Directors is responsible for supervision of the overall affairs of IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist it in carrying out its duties, the Board has delegated certain authority to several committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the Annual Meeting in 2017, the Board will consist of 13 directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the interim between Annual Meetings, the Board has the authority under the by-laws to increase or decrease the size of the Board and to fill vacancies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board held nine meetings during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee recognize the importance of director attendance at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, overall attendance at Board and committee meetings was over 96%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance was at least 75% for each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about Board attendance at IBMs 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and IBMs policy with regard to Board members attendance at annual meetings of stockholders is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/director-attendance-at-annual-meeting.html?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: subtabs=open.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs Board of Directors has long adhered to governance principles designed to assure the continued vitality of the Board and excellence in the execution of its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1994, the Board has had in place a set of governance guidelines reflecting these principles, including the Boards policy of requiring a majority of the Board to be comprised of independent directors, the importance of equity compensation to align the interests of directors and stockholders, and regularly scheduled executive sessions, including sessions of non-management directors without members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive session with independent directors is held at least once a year, and the non-management directors met in executive session eight times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Board Corporate Governance Guidelines reflect IBMs principles on corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines are available at
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/corporate-governance-guidelines.html?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: subtabs=open.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for leading the search for qualified individuals for election as directors to ensure the Board has the right mix of skills, expertise and background.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the following attributes are key to ensuring the continued vitality of the Board and excellence in the execution of its duties: experience as a leader of a business, firm or institution; mature and practical judgment; the ability to comprehend and analyze complex matters; effective interpersonal and communication skills; and strong character and integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of IBMs directors has these attributes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In identifying potential director candidates, the Committee and the Board also focus on ensuring that the Board reflects a diversity of experiences, backgrounds and individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Board is composed of a diverse group of members, all leaders in their respective fields.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of the current directors have leadership experience at major domestic and international companies with operations inside and outside the United States, as well as experience on other companies boards, which provides an understanding of different business processes, challenges and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other directors have experience as presidents of significant academic, research and philanthropic institutions, which brings unique perspectives to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, IBMs directors also have other experience that makes them valuable members, such as prior public policy or regulatory experience that provides insight into issues faced by companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board believe that the above-mentioned attributes, along with the leadership skills and other experiences of its Board members described below, provide IBM with the perspectives and judgment necessary to guide IBMs strategies and monitor their execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the IBM Board Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the full Board annually review the financial and other relationships between the non-management directors and IBM as part of the annual assessment of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee makes recommendations to the Board about the independence of non-management directors, and the Board determines whether those directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independence criteria established by the Board in accordance with New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) requirements and used by the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board in their assessment of the independence of directors is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/director-independence-standards.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applying those standards for the non-management directors in 2016, including those not standing for election, the Committee and the Board have determined that each of the following directors has met the independence standards: A.J.P. Belda, W.R. Brody, K.I. Chenault, M.L. Eskew, D.N. Farr, M. Fields, A. Gorsky, S.A. Jackson, A.N. Liveris, W.J. McNerney, Jr., H.S. Olayan, J.W. Owens, J.E. Spero, S. Taurel and P.R. Voser.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Eskews son is employed by IBM and is not an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was hired over a year before Mr. Eskew joined IBMs Board, and his compensation and other terms of employment are determined on a basis consistent with IBMs human resources policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the foregoing, the Board has determined that this relationship does not preclude a finding of independence for Mr. Eskew.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted below, the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for the continuing review of the governance structure of the Board, and for recommending to the Board those structures and practices best suited to IBM and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and the Board recognize that different structures may be appropriate under different circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Rometty serves as IBMs Chairman and CEO and Mr. Eskew serves as Presiding Director, a structure which the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board believe is in the best interests of IBM and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Presiding Director has the following responsibilities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serve as liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve information sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve meeting agendas for the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve meeting schedules to assure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have authority to call meetings of the independent directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if requested by major stockholders, ensure that he or she is available, as necessary after discussions with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, for consultation and direct communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, on occasion, the Presiding Director attends other committee meetings in addition to the committee he chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board as a whole believe that this leadership structure provides IBM with the benefits of combining the leadership role of Chairman and CEO, while also recognizing the unique strengths and capabilities of IBMs Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An independent Presiding Director with these clearly defined duties and responsibilities further enhances the contributions of IBMs independent directors, which have been and continue to be substantial.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Eskew, the Presiding Director, has significant global business, leadership and oversight experience as the former chairman and chief executive officer of United Parcel Service, Inc., the current chairman of the Annie E. Casey Foundation, and a board member of Allstate Corporation, Eli Lilly and Company and 3M Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, much attention has been given to the subject of risk and how companies assess and manage risks across the enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At IBM, we believe that innovation and leadership are impossible without taking risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also recognize that imprudent acceptance of risk or the failure to appropriately identify and mitigate risks could be destructive of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior management is responsible for assessing and managing IBMs various exposures to risk on a day-to-day basis, including the creation of appropriate risk management programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM has developed a consistent, systemic and integrated approach to risk management to help determine how best to identify, manage and mitigate significant risks throughout IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for overseeing management in the execution of its responsibilities and for assessing IBMs approach to risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board exercises these responsibilities periodically as part of its meetings and also through the Boards three committees, each of which examines various components of enterprise risk as part of their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically reviews IBMs enterprise management framework, including IBMs enterprise risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, an overall review of risk is inherent in the Boards consideration of IBMs long-term strategies and in the transactions and other matters presented to the Board, including capital expenditures, acquisitions and divestitures, and financial matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards role in risk oversight of IBM is consistent with IBMs leadership structure, with the CEO and other members of senior management having responsibility for assessing and managing IBMs risk exposure, and the Board and its committees providing oversight in connection with those efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process by which stockholders and other interested parties may communicate with the Board or non-management directors of IBM is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/contact-the-board.html?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for reviewing reports of IBMs financial results, audits, internal controls and adherence to IBMs Business Conduct Guidelines in compliance with applicable laws and regulations, including federal procurement requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee selects the independent registered public accounting firm and reviews its selection with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of each year, the Audit Committee approves the proposed services to be provided by the accounting firm during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee chair pursuant to authority delegated by the Audit Committee may approve engagements that are outside the scope of the services and fees approved by the Committee which are later presented to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the procedures of the independent registered public accounting firm for ensuring its independence with respect to the services performed for IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Committee are non-management directors who, in the opinion of the Board, satisfy the independence criteria established by the Board, the standards of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that Mr. Eskew qualifies as an Audit Committee Financial Expert as defined by the rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee held six meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Board of Directors has adopted a written charter for the Committee, which is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/audit-committee-charter.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Business Conduct Guidelines (BCGs) are IBMs code of ethics for directors, executive officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amendment to, or waiver of, the BCGs that applies to our directors or executive officers may be made only by the IBM Board or a Board committee and would be disclosed on IBMs website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The BCGs are available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/business-conduct-guidelines.html?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: subtabs=open.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Directors and Corporate Governance Committee is devoted primarily to the continuing review and articulation of the governance structure of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, the Committee is responsible for recommending qualified candidates to the Board for election as directors of IBM, including the slate of directors that the Board proposes for election by stockholders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recommends candidates based on their business or professional experience, the diversity of their background, and their talents and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee identifies candidates through a variety of means, including information the Committee requests from time to time from the Secretary of IBM, recommendations from members of the Committee and the Board, suggestions from IBM management, including the CEO and, from time to time, a third-party search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any formal invitation to a director candidate is authorized by the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers candidates recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders wishing to recommend director candidates for consideration by the Committee may do so by writing to the Secretary of IBM, giving the recommended candidates name, biographical data and qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also advises and makes recommendations to the Board on all matters concerning directorship practices, and on the function and duties of the committees of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee makes recommendations to the Board on compensation for non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee currently retains Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook) to assess trends and developments in director compensation practices and to compare IBMs practices against them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses the analysis prepared by the consultant as part of its periodic review of IBMs director compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than services provided to IBMs Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and IBMs Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee, FW Cook does not perform any other work for IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that FW Cook is free of conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for reviewing and considering IBMs position and practices on significant issues of corporate public responsibility, such as workforce diversity, protection of the environment and philanthropic contributions, and it reviews and considers stockholder proposals, including those dealing with issues of public and social interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Committee are non- management directors who, in the opinion of the Board, satisfy the independence criteria established by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee held three meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Board of Directors has adopted a written charter for the Committee, which is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/director-and-corporate-governance.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee has responsibility for defining and articulating IBMs overall executive compensation philosophy, and administering
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and approving all elements of compensation for elected corporate officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approves, by direct action or through delegation, participation in and all awards, grants and related actions under IBMs various equity plans, reviews changes in IBMs pension plans primarily affecting corporate officers, and manages the operation and administration of the IBM Supplemental Executive Retention Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the direct responsibility to review and approve the corporate goals and objectives relevant to the Chairman and CEOs compensation, evaluate her performance in light of those goals and objectives and, together with the other independent directors, determine and approve the Chairman and CEOs compensation level based on this evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also has responsibility for reviewing IBMs management resources programs and for recommending qualified candidates to the Board for election as officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the compensation structure for IBMs officers and provides oversight of managements decisions regarding performance and compensation of other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee monitors compliance of stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All equity awards for employees other than senior management are approved by senior management, pursuant to a series of delegations that were approved by the Committee, and the grants made under these delegations are reviewed periodically with the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chair of the Committee works directly with the Committees compensation consultant to provide a decision-making framework for use in making a recommendation for the Chairman and CEOs total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, IBMs Chairman and CEO and the IBM Senior Vice President of Human Resources (SVP HR) review the self-assessments of the Senior Vice Presidents and evaluate the information, along with comparisons to market compensation levels for cash compensation and total direct compensation, potential for future roles within IBM and total compensation levels relative to internal peers before and after any recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this in-depth review, and in consultation with the SVP HR, the Chairman and CEO makes compensation recommendations to the Committee based on her evaluation of each senior executives performance and expectations for the coming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the sole authority to retain consultants and advisors as it may deem appropriate in its discretion, and the Committee has the sole authority to approve related fees and other retention terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retains Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook) as its compensation consultant to advise the Committee on market practices and specific IBM policies and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook reports directly to the Compensation Committee Chairman and takes direction from the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultants work for the Committee includes data analyses, market assessments, and preparation of related reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than services provided to IBMs Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee and IBMs Directors and Corporate Governance Committee, FW Cook does not perform any other work for IBM, and the work done by them for the Committee is documented in a formal agreement executed by FW Cook and the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Section 1 of the 2016 Compensation Discussion and Analysis for additional information about the Committees consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reports to stockholders as required by the SEC (see 2016 Report of the Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee of the Board of Directors below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Committee are non-management directors who, in the opinion of the Board, satisfy the independence criteria established by applicable regulations and by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee members are not eligible to participate in any of the plans or programs that the Committee administers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee held six meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Board of Directors has adopted a written charter for the Committee, which is available at http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/executive-compensation-and-management-resources.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Gorsky, Liveris, McNerney and Taurel served as members of the Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Committee were independent directors, and no member was an employee or former employee of IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, none of our executive officers served on the compensation committee or board of directors of another entity whose executive officer served on our Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee or Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, there is no relationship that requires disclosure as a Compensation Committee interlock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee is empowered to act for the full Board in intervals between Board meetings, with the exception of certain matters that by law may not be delegated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee meets as necessary, and all actions by the Committee are reported at the next Board of Directors meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee did not meet in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN TRANSACTIONS AND RELATIONSHIPS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under IBMs written related person transactions policy, information about transactions involving related persons is assessed by the independent directors on IBMs Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include IBM directors and executive officers, as well as immediate family members of directors and officers, and beneficial owners of more than five percent of IBMs common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the determination is made that a related person has a material interest in any IBM transaction, then IBMs independent directors would review, approve or ratify it, and the transaction would be required to be disclosed in accordance with the SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the related person at issue is a director of IBM, or a family member of a director, then that director would not participate in those discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, IBM is of the view that the following transactions with related persons are not significant to investors because they take place under IBMs standard policies and procedures: the sale or purchase of products or services in the ordinary course of business and on an arms-length basis; the employment by IBM where the compensation and other terms of employment are determined on a basis consistent with IBMs human resources policies; and any grants or contributions made by IBM under one of its grant programs and in accordance with IBMs corporate contributions guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, IBM may have employees who are related to our executive officers or directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted in the discussion above on General Information  Board of Directors, Mr. Eskews son is employed by IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is an executive of IBM (not an executive officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a brother-in-law of Mrs. V.M. Rometty (Chairman and CEO), the wife of Mr. M. Jetter (Senior Vice President, IBM Global Technology Services), and the wife of Mr. R.F. Del Bene (Vice President and Controller) are employed as executives of IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The wife of Mr. R.J. Picciano (Senior Vice President, IBM Cognitive Systems), a daughter of Mr. Del Bene, and a brother of Dr. J.E. Kelly III (Senior Vice President, IBM Cognitive Solutions and IBM Research) are also employed by IBM in non- executive positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the above-referenced family member employees are executive officers of IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each employee mentioned above received compensation in 2016 between $120,000 and $850,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in 2016, the above-referenced family members of Mrs. Rometty and Messrs. Eskew and Jetter, as well as the wife of Mr. Del Bene, each received equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation, equity grants and other terms of employment of each of the family member employees noted above are determined on a basis consistent with IBMs human resources policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CERTAIN INFORMATION ABOUT INSURANCE AND INDEMNIFICATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM has renewed its directors and officers indemnification insurance coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This insurance covers directors and officers individually where exposures exist other than those for which IBM is able to provide indemnification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This coverage runs from June 30, 2016 through June 30, 2017, at a total cost of approximately $5.4 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary carrier is XL Specialty Insurance Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 DIRECTOR COMPENSATION NARRATIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Retainer: In 2016, non-management directors received an annual retainer of $300,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairs of the Directors and Corporate Governance Committee and the Executive Compensation and Management Resources Committee received an additional annual retainer of $20,000 and the chair of the Audit Committee received an additional annual retainer of $25,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retainer for the Presiding Director position is a total of $50,000, inclusive of any committee chair retainer received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, Mr. Eskew, the Presiding Director and the chair of the Audit Committee, received $25,000 for the Presiding Director role and $25,000 for the Audit Committee chair role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the IBM Deferred Compensation and Equity Award Plan (DCEAP), 60% of the total annual retainer is required to be deferred and paid in Promised Fee Shares (PFS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each PFS is equal in value to one share of IBMs common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a cash dividend is paid on IBMs common stock, each directors PFS account is credited with additional PFS reflecting a dividend equivalent payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the payment of the remaining 40% of the annual retainer, directors may elect one or any combination of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) deferral into PFS,

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 REPORT OF THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND MANAGEMENT RESOURCES COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set out below is the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, which is a discussion of IBMs executive compensation programs and policies written from the perspective of how we and management view and use such programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the Committees role in providing oversight to the design of those programs and policies, and in making specific compensation decisions for senior executives using those policies and programs, the Committee participated in the preparation of the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, reviewing successive drafts of the document and discussing those with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We join with management in welcoming readers to examine our pay practices and in affirming the commitment of these pay practices to the long-term interests of stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alex Gorsky Andrew N. Liveris W. James McNerney, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sidney Taurel (chair)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, IBM emerged as the recognized cognitive solutions and cloud platform company  the result of a multi-year transformation of the business portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM reinvented its core hardware, software, and services franchises, while investing to create new ones such as IBM Cloud, IBM Analytics, IBM Security, and the Watson businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A strong foundation is now in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific highlights of performance include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated revenue of $79.9 billion and GAAP net income from continuing operations of $11.9 billion (operating non-GAAP net income of $13.0 billion).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered GAAP gross margin of 48%, reflecting the investments made in acquisitions and our as-a-Service business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved GAAP diluted earnings per share from continuing operations of $12.39 and (operating non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $13.59).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated $17.0 billion in cash from operations and $11.6 billion in free cash flow, with a strong realization rate of 97% of GAA net income, while continuing our investment in research & development and capital expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintained IBMs industry-leading position in cloud with revenue of $13.7 billion, up 35% year over year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exited the year with a cloud as-a-Service run rate of $8.6 billion, up 61%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued momentum in our high-value businesses providing world-class innovation to our clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Software Solutions grew 5%, Technology Services and Cloud Platforms grew 1% and our total Software revenue was flat at actual rates, returning to growth at constant currency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation strategy supports IBMs emergence as the cognitive solutions and cloud platform company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is designed to ensure that executives balance short-term objectives against long-term priorities, to align executive and stockholder interests, and to attract and retain the leadership needed to deliver strong results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay decisions were made in the context of our financial performance relative to our goals, while taking into account the transformation made in the Companys portfolio and the steps taken to strengthen IBMs position for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, at target, 69% of Mrs. Romettys pay was at risk and subject to attainment of specific performance goals, excluding the one- time premium-priced option award described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 performance, the Board approved an annual incentive payment of $4.95 million for Mrs. Rometty, which represented 99% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout level considered significant progress in the implementation of IBMs strategy, with continued growth in Strategic Imperatives, momentum in cognitive, and the creation of new businesses in health care, Internet of Things, and financial regulatory compliance, including several sizeable acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee noted significant continued increases in employee engagement, and major steps taken to realign workforce skills and strengthen senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking into consideration the actual salary, annual incentive payout and long-term incentive award for the period 20142016, Mrs. Rometty earned 54% of her annual total target compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, the independent members of the Board made no change to Mrs. Romettys base salary, target annual incentive or annual long-term incentive award value, relative to 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As disclosed last year in the 2016 Proxy Statement, the Board granted Mrs. Rometty a one-time award of 1.5 million nonqualified stock options that vest three years from the date of grant, are exercisable in four equal tranches at premium prices of 105%, 110%, 115% and 125% of the fair market value of IBM common stock on the date of grant, and expire 10 years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This premium-priced stock option award demonstrates the Boards strong confidence in Mrs. Romettys leadership of IBM and the momentum of its strategic direction as well as the Boards desire to ensure her continued service through a critical period in IBMs multi-year transformation, align her compensation closely with increases in shareholder value over the long-term, and, when combined with her ongoing compensation, deliver a market-competitive performance-based total compensation opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While one-time stock grants are prevalent in our industry for leaders navigating companies through extraordinary periods of transformation, this grant is unique in several ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, it is an option grant with value being derived only when incremental value is created for shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, its premium-priced mechanism serves to increase even further the incremental value shareholders must receive relative to a typical option grant in which the exercise price is set at fair market value on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This performance-sensitive design ensures that Mrs. Rometty is only compensated if there has been significant appreciation in shareholder value after the time of vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the four tranches will expire valueless if the IBM stock price fails to appreciate to the levels described above, thereby ensuring that realized compensation, if any, is tied to the successful business transformation being led by Mrs. Rometty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the transformation is a defining moment not only for IBM, but also for the industry, and this grant reflects that significance and delivers value if, and only if, successful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Note: In an effort to provide additional and useful information regarding IBMs financial results and other financial information as determined by generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), this Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Proxy Statement contains certain non-GAAP financial measures on a continuing operations basis, including software revenue at constant currency,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operating earnings per share, free cash flow and operating (non-GAAP) earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For reconciliation and rationale for managements use of this non-GAAP information refer to Appendix A  Non-GAAP Financial Information and Reconciliations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM continually reviews its corporate governance and executive compensation structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this review, it is IBMs longstanding practice for our executives to meet with a significant number of our largest investors to solicit their feedback on a variety of topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, IBM once again engaged with over 100 institutional investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM considered the results of the management Say on Pay proposal presented to the stockholders for approval in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the support the proposal received, IBMs compensation policies and decisions, explained in detail in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, continue to be focused on long-term financial performance to drive stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM provides an advisory vote on executive compensation (Say on Pay) on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below highlights practices that IBM embraces in support of our pay-for-performance philosophy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No individual severance or change-in-control agreements for executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tie a significant portion of pay to company performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigate risk taking by emphasizing long-term equity incentives, placing caps on potential payments, and maintaining robust clawback provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No excise tax gross-ups
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividend equivalents on unearned RSUs/PSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require significant share ownership by the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No hedging/pledging of IBM stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No stock option repricing, exchanges or options granted below market value
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Utilize noncompetition and nonsolicitation agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No guaranteed incentive payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No accelerated vesting of equity awards for executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No above-market returns on deferred compensation plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 1: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAM DESIGN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trust and personal responsibility in all relationships  relationships with clients, partners, communities, fellow IBMers, and investors  is a core value at IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of maintaining this trust, we well understand the need for our investors  not only professional fund managers and institutional investor groups, but also millions of individual investors  to know how and why compensation decisions are made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, IBMs executive compensation practices are designed specifically to meet five key objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensure that the interests of IBMs leaders are closely aligned with those of our investors by varying compensation based on both long-term and annual business results and delivering a large portion of the total pay opportunity in IBM stock; Balance rewards for both short-term results and the long-term strategic decisions needed to ensure sustained business performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain the highly qualified senior leaders needed to drive a global enterprise to succeed in todays highly competitive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Differentiate rewards to reflect individual and team performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific elements of IBMs U.S. executive compensation programs are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Type Component Key Characteristics Current Year Performance Salary Salary is a market-competitive, fixed level of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive At target, annual incentive provides a market-competitive total cash opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual annual incentive payments are driven by business performance against financial metrics and individual performance, with top performers typically earning the greatest payouts and the lowest performers earning no incentive payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Plan Performance Share Units (PSUs) Equity awards are typically made annually and may be made in PSUs, RSUs or a combination thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity grants are based on the level of the executive and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lower performers do not receive equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For PSUs, the number of units granted is adjusted at the end of the three-year performance period based on IBMs performance against predetermined targets for operating earnings per share and free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs vest over time, typically over one to four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)                     Retention Stock-Based Grants & Cash Awards Periodically, the Compensation Committee and/or the Chairman and CEO reviews outstanding stock-based awards for key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending on individual performance and the competitive environment for senior executive leadership talent, awards may be made in the form of restricted stock units, premium-priced stock options or cash for certain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention Restricted Stock Unit (RRSU) vesting periods typically range from two to five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash awards have a clawback if an executive leaves IBM before a specified date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Premium-priced stock options may have varying exercise prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental Executive Retention Plan (closed) In 1995, IBM created a plan in the U.S. to help retain, for their full careers, the caliber of senior leaders needed to turn IBM around, preserve its long-term viability, and position it for growth in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To discourage these leaders from joining competitors, their benefits under this retention plan would be forfeited if they left IBM prior to age 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan was closed to new participants in 2004 and future accruals under the plan stopped on December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension & Savings Plans Pension Plans (closed) In the U.S. accruals under the pension plans stopped on December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the pension benefit under these plans is based on pay and service as of such date and is determined by the same formulas for executives and non-executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Savings Plan The money that U.S. executives save through the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan, as for all U.S. employees, is eligible for IBM match and automatic contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plus Plan is the only tax-qualified retirement program available to IBMs U.S. employees for future deferrals and employer contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Savings Plan IBM has a nonqualified deferred compensation plan established in accordance with U.S. Department of Labor and Internal Revenue Service guidelines to enable employees to defer compensation in excess of limits applicable to 401(k) plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are eligible for IBM match and automatic contributions similar to the 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Perquisites and Other Benefits Perquisites are intended to ensure safety and productivity of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites include such things as annual physicals, transportation, financial planning, and personal security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Leadership Team  Personal Stake in IBMs Future through Stock Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investors want the leaders of their companies to act like owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That alignment, we believe, works best when senior leaders have meaningful portions of their personal holdings invested in the stock of their company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is why IBM sets significant stock ownership requirements for IBMs Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table illustrates which equity holdings count towards stock ownership requirements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Counts What Does Not Count  IBM shares owned personally or by members of the immediate family sharing the same household  Unvested equity awards, including PSUs, RSUs and RRSUs     Holdings in the IBM Stock Fund of the 401(k) Plus Plan and the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan Unexercised stock options     Shares of IBM stock deferred under the Excess 401(k) Plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents are all required to own IBM shares or equivalents worth three times their individual total target cash compensation within five years of hire or promotion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the majority of the Fortune 100 companies who establish ownership guidelines using a multiple of only base salary, IBM uses a multiple of base salary plus target annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures that meaningful ownership levels are accumulated based on each executives annual cash compensation opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, as a group, the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents owned shares or equivalents valued at over $129 million; in fact, as of that date, this group held, on average, 140% of the amount of IBM shares or equivalents that IBM requires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting Performance Targets for Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of our senior leaders is linked with IBMs performance against core business metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics and their weightings are aligned with IBMs financial and strategic objectives and are designed to appropriately balance short- and long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets are set for both the annual and long-term incentive programs at aggressive levels each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These targets, individually and together, are designed to be challenging to attain and are consistent with our financial model shared with investors each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of IBMs ongoing management system, targets are evaluated to ensure they do not encourage an inappropriate amount of risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, IBM continued to measure five key financial metrics:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Net Cash from Operating Activities, excluding Global Financing receivables
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic Imperatives revenue supports IBMs portfolio shift into a cognitive solutions and cloud platform company that will deliver the highest-value opportunities for our clients and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating net income and operating EPS best measure our operational success as a high-value company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both free cash flow and operating cash flow are important measures of IBMs ability to reinvest and return value to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these metrics best align the interests of management with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM shares its financial model each year with investors in the context of its long-term strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the financial model is clearly communicated to investors, and our performance targets are based on this model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM competes for client business, talent and investment opportunities in a highly dynamic and competitive marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we do not disclose specific targets within the annual and long-term plans because such disclosure could disadvantage IBM competitively and impair the Companys ability to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: execute our strategic plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, disclosure of our free cash flow targets would provide insight into timing of large capital investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, IBM has a specific acquisition and divestiture strategy that could be negatively impacted if the specific targets were disclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we do not disclose specific targets for competitive reasons, the difficulty and rigor of these targets is apparent in our payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since becoming CEO, Mrs. Romettys annual incentive payout has ranged from 0% to 108% and Performance Share Unit payouts have ranged from 32% to 113% during that same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also describe annual performance in our discussion of named executive officer compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, outlined below is a description of the specific metrics and weightings for the Annual Incentive and the Performance Share Unit Programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM sets business objectives at the beginning of each year which are approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These objectives translate to targets for IBM and for each business unit for purposes of determining the target funding of the Annual Incentive Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance against business objectives determines the actual total funding pool for the year which can vary from 0% to 200% of total target incentives for all executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors review IBMs annual business objectives and set the metrics and weightings for the annual program reflecting current business priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metrics and weightings for 2016 and 2017 are listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 and 2017 Weighting   Financial Metric in Overall Score   Operating Net Income 40% Strategic Imperatives Revenue 20% Operating Cash Flow 40%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the year, performance for IBM is assessed against these predetermined financial targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance results against these targets may be adjusted for extraordinary events if deemed appropriate by the Chairman and CEO and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This adjustment can be either up or down.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, adjustments are usually made for large divestitures and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Chairman and CEO can recommend an adjustment, up or down, based on factors beyond IBMs financial performance, for example, client experience, market share growth and workforce development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking such matters into account for 2016, no such adjustment was made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the financial scoring and qualitative adjustments and approves the Annual Incentive Program funding level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the total pool funding level has been approved, a lower-performing executive will receive as little as zero payout and the most exceptional performers are capped at three times their individual target incentive (payouts at this level are rare and only possible when IBMs performance has also been exceptional).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, IBMs Annual Incentive Programs financial performance score was slightly below par.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic Imperatives revenue, operating net income, and operating cash flow attainment fell slightly below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Unit Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Performance Share Units, the two metrics are operating EPS and free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targets for the Performance Share Unit program are set at the beginning of each three-year performance period, taking into account IBMs financial model shared with investors and the annual budget as approved by the Board, including the impact our share buyback program has on operating EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, for Performance Share Unit awards starting in 2016 and beyond, the Committee has determined that actual operating EPS results will be adjusted to remove the impact of any difference between the actual share count and the budgeted share count.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This method formalizes the Committees longstanding intention of not having unplanned share repurchase practices affect executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the scoring for the Performance Share Unit Program takes into account extraordinary events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in 2014 and 2015, operating EPS reflected the impact of the Microelectronics divestiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the three years, the score is calculated based on results against the predetermined targets, with the following weights:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 and 2017 Weighting   Financial Metric in Overall Score   Operating Earnings Per Share 70%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free Cash Flow
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves the determination of actual performance relative to pre-established targets, and the number of Performance Share Units is adjusted up or down based on the approved actual performance from 0% to 150%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no discretionary adjustment to the Performance Share Unit program score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the Performance Share Units granted in 2014, the final performance score was well below par.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both operating EPS and free cash flow for the three-year period (20142016) were below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 2: HOW AND WHY COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE MADE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At any level, compensation reflects an employees value to the business  market value of skills, individual contribution and business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be sure we appropriately assess the value of senior executives, IBM follows an evaluation process, described here in some detail:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Making Commitments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All IBM employees, including the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents, develop goals, both qualitative and quantitative, they seek to achieve in a particular year in support of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2016, IBM adopted a more nimble and real-time approach to managing employee performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees performance goals are discussed with each individuals manager regularly and updated as necessary throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman and CEOs performance goals are reviewed directly by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, many factors are considered, including an understanding of the business risks associated with the performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Determining Compensation for the Chairman and CEO  Research, Recommendations and Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chair of the Compensation Committee works directly with the Committees compensation consultant, Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook), to provide a decision-making framework for use by the Committee in determining incentive plan payouts and setting target compensation opportunities for the Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This framework considers the Chairman and CEOs self- assessment of performance against commitments in the year, both qualitative and quantitative, and also considers progress against strategic objectives, an analysis of IBMs total performance over a multi-year period, a competitive benchmark analysis, and other relevant information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers all of this information in developing its recommendations, which are then presented to the independent members of the IBM Board of Directors for further review, discussion and final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Determining Compensation for Senior Vice Presidents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluation of Results by the Chairman and CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees at all levels, including executives, work with their managers throughout the year to evaluate their own results against their stated goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The self-assessments of the Senior Vice Presidents are reviewed by the Senior Vice President of Human Resources (SVP HR) and the Chairman and CEO, who evaluate the information, along with the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comparisons to market compensation levels for cash compensation and total direct compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential for future roles within IBM; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total compensation levels relative to internal peers before and after any recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this in-depth review and in consultation with the SVP HR, the Chairman and CEO makes compensation recommendations to the Compensation Committee based on an evaluation of each Senior Vice Presidents performance and expectations for the coming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluation of Results by the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee decides whether to approve or adjust the Chairman and CEOs recommendations for the Senior Vice Presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates all of the factors considered by the Chairman and CEO and reviews compensation summaries that tally the dollar value of all compensation and related programs, including salary, annual incentive, long-term compensation, deferred compensation, retention payments and pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These summaries provide the Committee with an understanding of how their decisions affect other compensation elements and the impact that separation of employment or retirement will have.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Ensuring Competitive Pay  Approach to Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM participates in several executive compensation surveys that provide general trend information and details on levels of salary, target annual incentives and long-term incentives, the relative mix of short- and long-term incentives, and mix of cash and stock-based pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the battle for talent that exists in our industry, the benchmark companies that are used by the Compensation Committee to guide its decision making have included a broad range of key information technology companies, to help us identify trends in the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also include companies outside our industry, with stature, size and complexity that approximate our own, in recognition of the fact that competition for senior management talent is not limited to our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The surveys and benchmark data are supplemented by input from the Compensation Committees outside consultant on factors such as recent market trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and approves this list annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee re-examined the benchmark group for 2016 and determined that companies which meet the following criteria should be included in the 2016 benchmark group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies in the technology industry with revenue that exceeds $15 billion, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional companies (up to two per industry if available) in industries other than technology, with revenue that exceeds $40 billion and that have a global complexity similar to IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Benchmark Group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accenture   EMC Oracle Amazon.com   ExxonMobil PepsiCo Apple   Ford Pfizer AT&T   General Electric United Boeing   Google Technologies Caterpillar   Hewlett-Packard UPS Chevron   Intel Verizon Cisco Systems   Johnson & Johnson Xerox Dow Chemical   Microsoft
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017 compensation decisions, the Committee approved the following benchmark group using the criteria above and reflecting changes in the corporate structure of certain competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Benchmark Group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accenture   Dow Chemical Microsoft Alphabet   ExxonMobil Oracle Amazon.com   Ford PepsiCo Apple   General Electric Pfizer AT&T   Hewlett- United Boeing   Packard Enterprises Technologies Caterpillar   HP Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: UPS Chevron   Intel Verizon Cisco Systems   Johnson & Johnson Xerox
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The data from compensation surveys and related sources form the primary external view of the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In consideration of size and complexity, IBMs philosophy is to generally target the 50th percentile of the market for cash and total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Owing to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: size and scope of our business overall, some roles are compared to a size-adjusted market rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For individual compensation decisions, the benchmark information is used together with an internal view of longer-term potential, ndividual performance relative to other executives and recognizing that the skills and experience of our senior executives are highly sought after by other companies and, in particular, by IBMs competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because factors such as performance and retention, as well as size and complexity of the job role, are considered when compensation decisions are made, the cash and total compensation for an ndividual named executive officer may be higher or lower than the target reference point of the relevant benchmark group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Compensation Committee Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee enters into a consulting agreement with its outside compensation consultant on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has retained FW Cook as its compensation consultant to advise the Committee on market practices and specific IBM policies and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook reports directly to the Compensation Committee Chairman and takes direction from the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultants work for the Committee includes data analyses, market assessments and preparation of related reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, the Committee seeks the views of the consultant on items such as incentive program design and market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The work done by FW Cook for the Committee is documented in a formal agreement which is executed by the consultant and the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook does not perform any other work for IBM, other than services provided to IBMs Directors and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that there is no conflict of interest with regard to FW Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee made recommendations for Mrs. Romettys 2016 and 2017 compensation following the process and using the pay components described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 ANNUAL INCENTIVE DECISION FOR THE CHAIRMAN AND CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the overall IBM performance detailed in the Executive Summary, the Compensation Committee noted the following personal leadership achievements for Mrs. Rometty, all of which are clear sign posts of the successful business portfolio shift:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directed investments to Strategic Imperatives  cloud, analytics, mobile, social and security  growing revenue to $33 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Th Strategic Imperatives contributed 41% of IBMs total revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Established Watson as the premier artificial intelligence platform for business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Extended the reach of Watson on the IBM Cloud, open to millions of clients, developers, partners and users.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded IBMs cloud capabilities and broadened the ecosystem with over 50 cloud datacenters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Launched the Watson Financial Services unit and entered the global regulatory compliance market, enabled by the acquisition of Promontory Financial Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The newly launched unit brings clients an industry-specific combination of Watson, IBM Cloud, IBM Systems, blockchain, deep domain expertise and ecosystems of partners and developers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Established IBM as the global leader in applying blockchain technology to business, with more than 300 client projects underway.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ranked #1 in patents for the 24th consecutive year, continuing our leadership in technology and innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM was the first company to exceed 8,000 patents in a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drove significant productivity savings through work redesign and the deployment of cognitive solutions across IBMs internal operations, and positioned IBM for future growth by realigning workforce skills with the new portfolio and strengthening all levels of management, including senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to build on employee engagement momentum, with increases across virtually all markets and business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 performance, the Board approved an annual incentive payment of $4.95 million for Mrs. Rometty, which represented 99% of her target opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This payout considered her outstanding personal leadership through a landmark transformation and the significant growth in new business areas, balanced against underperformance in some other areas, such as Global Business Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking into consideration the actual salary, actual annual incentive payout and actual long-term incentive award for the period 2014 2016, Mrs. Rometty earned 54% of her annual total target compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 COMPENSATION DECISIONS FOR THE CHAIRMAN AND CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, the independent members of the Board made no change to Mrs. Romettys base salary or target annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was granted an annual long-term incentive award valued at $13.3 million, flat compared to the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This grant is comprised 65% of 20172019 Performance Share Units and 35% of Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, 69% of Mrs. Romettys annual total target compensation is tied to performance-based incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 ANNUAL INCENTIVE DECISIONS FOR MR. SCHROETER, MR. JETTER, DR. KELLY AND MR. CLEMENTI
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also made decisions for the following named executive officers, noting overall corporate performance as described in the Executive Summary and the following key points:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Martin J. Schroeter,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shifted IBMs spending profile to focus on Strategic Imperatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invested $15 billion across research & development, capital spending and 15 acquisitions, adding to our capabilities in the high-growth areas of cognitive and cloud with industry focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implemented new segment reporting structure that aligns to IBMs emergence as a cloud platform and cognitive solutions company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Martin Jetter,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Vice President, IBM Global Technology Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grew Technology Services & Cloud Platforms Strategic Imperatives revenue 39%, with Cloud revenue up 49% and an as-a-Service annual exit run rate of $5.8 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shifted the business from systems integration to services integration, assisting our clients as they move to enterprise-grade cloud solutions that are secure, agile, and that leverage the data and investments in their core systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John E. Kelly III,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Vice President, IBM Cognitive Solutions & IBM Research
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led Solutions Software which had revenue growth of 5% and drove an as-a-Service annual exit run rate of $1.8 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Embedded cognitive capabilities in Commerce, Analytics, Security, Watson Health, Internet of Things, and financial services solutions; and drove the integration of the Watson and IBM Cloud platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed five Cognitive Solutions acquisitions, including assets of The Weather Company, whose high-volume data platform serves as the foundation for IBMs Watson Internet of Things Cloud platform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved #1 patent position for the 24th consecutive year, with over 8,000 patents in areas from bioinformatics to nanotechnology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Launched the first ever commercial program for universal quantum computing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Erich Clementi,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Vice President, IBM Global Markets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enabled IBM to deliver $33 billion of Strategic Imperatives revenue, up 13%, with strong contributions from IBMs two biggest geographic markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deployed a new operating model, which increased the productivity of IBMs sales force, fostering speed in addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the process outlined above and based on business and individual performance, the Compensation Committee approved the 2016 annual incentive payouts below for these named executive officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual   Name Incentive Payouts   M.J. Schroeter $ 1,046,430 M. Jetter 901,890 J.E. Kelly III 927,350 E. Clementi 889,200
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking into consideration the actual salary, annual incentive payout and long-term incentive award for the period 20142016, these named executive officers earned from 50%-67% of their annual total target compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
