sentences.text: SECTION 3: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION PROGRAM AS IT RELATES TO RISK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM management, the Compensation Committee and the Committees outside consultant review IBMs compensation policies and practices, with a focus on incentive programs, to ensure that they do not encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review includes the cash incentive programs and the long-term incentive plans that cover all executives and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this comprehensive review, we concluded that our compensation program does not encourage excessive risk taking for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our programs appropriately balance short- and long-term incentives, with approximately 71% of 2017 annual total target compensation for the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents as a group provided in equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualitative factors beyond the quantitative financial metrics are a key consideration in the determination of individual executive compensation payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How our executives achieve their financial results, integrate across lines of business and demonstrate leadership consistent with IBM values are key to individual compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As explained in the 2016 Potential Payments Upon Termination Narrative, we further strengthened our retirement policies on equity grants for our senior leaders beginning in 2009 to ensure that the long-term interests of IBM continue to be the focus even as these executives approach retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM has a policy that requires a clawback of cash incentive payments in the event that an executive officers conduct leads to a restatement of IBMs financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, IBMs equity plan has a clawback provision which states that awards may be cancelled and certain gains repaid if an employee engages in detrimental activity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further reinforce our commitment to ethical conduct, the IBM Excess 401(k) Plus Plan allows the clawback of certain IBM contributions if a participant engages in detrimental activity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are confident that our compensation program is aligned with the interests of our stockholders, rewards for performance and represents strong executive compensation governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EQUITY AWARD PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under IBMs long-standing practices and policies, all equity awards are approved before or on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of at-the-money stock options is the average of the high and low market price on the date of grant or, in the case of premium-priced stock options, for example, 10% above that average, or as specified by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval process specifies the individual receiving the grant, the number of units or the value of the award, the exercise price or formula for determining the exercise price, and the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of planned grant value, the number of shares granted are determined by dividing the planned value by the predetermined, formulaic planning price in effect for the quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs planning price is computed each quarter using a consistent statistical forecasting procedure based on historical IBM stock price data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM uses the quarterly planning price to aid in establishing the overall size of the equity plan and to give more consistency across equity grants made at different points in the quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with all compensation decisions, the independent members of the Board approve all equity awards for the Chairman and CEO and ratify all equity awards for the Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all equity awards for Senior Vice Presidents are approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All equity awards for employees other than the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents are approved by the Chairman and CEO and Senior Vice Presidents pursuant to a series of delegations that were approved by the Compensation Committee, and the grants made pursuant to these delegations are reviewed periodically with the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards granted as part of annual total compensation for senior leaders and other employees are made on specific cycle dates scheduled in advance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs policy for new hires and promotions requires approval of any awards before or on the grant date, which is typically the date of the promotion or hire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM does not have any plans, programs or agreements that would provide any payments to any of the named executive officers upon a change in control of IBM, a change in the named executive officers responsibilities or a constructive termination of the named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ETHICAL CONDUCT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every executive is held accountable to comply with IBMs high ethical standards: IBMs Values, including Trust and Personal Responsibility in all Relationships, and IBMs Business Conduct Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This responsibility is reflected in each executives performance goals, and is reinforced through each executives annual certification to the IBM Business Conduct Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives compensation, including annual cash incentive payments, is tied to compliance with these standards; compliance is also a condition of IBM employment for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs equity plans and agreements have a clawback provision  awards may be cancelled and certain gains repaid if an employee engages in activity that is detrimental to IBM, such as violating IBMs Business Conduct Guidelines, disclosing confidential information or performing services for a competitor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further reinforce our commitment to ethical conduct, the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan allows the clawback of certain IBM contributions if a participant engages in activity that is detrimental to IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, approximately 2,000 of our key executives (including each of the named executive officers) have agreed to a noncompetition, nonsolicitation agreement that prevents them from working for certain competitors within 12 months of leaving IBM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or soliciting employees within two years of leaving IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has also implemented the following policy for the clawback of cash incentive payments in the event an executive officers conduct leads to a restatement of IBMs financial results:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by governing law, IBM will seek to recoup any bonus or incentive paid to any executive officer if
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the amount of such payment was based on the achievement of certain financial results that were subsequently the subject of a restatement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Board determines that such officer engaged in misconduct that resulted in the obligation to restate, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a lower payment would have been made to the officer based upon the restated financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEDGING AND PLEDGING PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM has two senior leadership teams: the Performance Team and the Growth and Transformation Team (G&TT).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Performance Team consists of approximately 70 of our senior leaders who run IBM business units and geographies and includes the Chairman and CEO and each Senior Vice President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The team is accountable for business performance and the development of cross-unit strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The G&TT, which includes all members of the Performance Team, consists of a select group of approximately 350 executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This team is charged with supporting IBMs continued transformation through their leadership initiatives to engage their teams and promote innovation, speed and simplicity in service of our clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM does not allow any member of the G&TT, including any named executive officer, to hedge the economic risk of their ownership of IBM securities, which includes entering into any derivative transaction on IBM stock (e.g., any short-sale, forward, option, collar).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, IBM does not allow any member of the G&TT to pledge IBM securities at any time, which includes having IBM stock in a margin account or using IBM stock as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX CONSIDERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, limits deductibility of compensation in excess of $1 million paid to IBMs CEO and to each of the other three highest-paid executive officers (not including IBMs chief financial officer) unless this compensation qualifies as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the applicable tax regulations, taxable compensation derived from certain stock appreciation rights and from the exercise of stock options by Senior Vice Presidents under IBMs Long-Term Performance Plans should qualify as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Excess 401(k) Plus Plan permits an executive officer who is subjec to Section 162(m) and whose salary is above $1 million to defer payment of a sufficient amount of the salary to bring it below the Section 162(m) limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1999, IBMs stockholders approved the terms under which IBMs annual and long-term performance incentive awards should qualify as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, as required by the Internal Revenue Code, the stockholders approved the material terms of the performance criteria under which long-term performance incentive awards should qualify as performance- based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These terms do not preclude the Committee from making any payments or granting any awards, whether or not such payments or awards qualify for tax deductibility under Section 162(m), which may be appropriate to retain and motivate key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 RETENTION PLAN NARRATIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Description and Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the mid-1990s, an additional form of retention compensation was created for certain IBM U.S. leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan, formally called the IBM Supplemental Executive Retention Plan (Retention Plan), began in 1995 during a particularly trying time in IBMs history when it faced challenges that many thought put its very existence at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some key leaders were recruited away from IBM during this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this environment, IBM created this new plan to help retain for full careers the caliber of senior leaders needed to turn IBM around, preserve its long-term viability and position it for growth in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because its original purpose had been met, the Retention Plan was closed to new participants effective May 1, 2004, and will not be replaced by any other plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future accruals under the Retention Plan stopped on December 31, 2007, therefore, a participants Retention Plan benefit does not consider pay earned or service performed after such date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments accrue based on age and service and are typically payable only after age 60, as a way to encourage senior leaders to continue working for IBM past the age when many others at IBM choose to retire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even though the Retention Plan provides for the payment of specified benefits after retirement, given the nature of this program as a retention vehicle, the Retention Plan is discussed in its own section instead of in the Pension Benefits section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a consequence, the amounts reflected below are separately presented in the 2016 Retention Plan Table and are not included in the 2016 Pension Benefits Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Retention Plan Table shows each eligible named executive officers number of years of credited service, present value of accumulated benefit and payments during the last fiscal year under the Retention Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retention Plan is a U.S. Plan and eligibility is based on U.S. employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Rometty and Dr. Kelly are eligible for a benefit under the Retention Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schroeter is not eligible for a Retention Plan benefit because he did not meet all of the eligibility criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, he did not continuously remain on the U.S. payroll, as he worked for IBM Australia from April 1, 2005 through June 30, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Jetter and Clementi began U.S. employment after the Retention Plan was closed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of Retention Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retention Plan provides for payment of an annual benefit as long as the participant satisfies the age, service, pay and job level requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective July 1, 1999, IBM amended the Retention Plan to provide a new benefit formula, but allowed participants who met certain age, service, and pay level conditions as of June 30, 1999 to continue to earn benefits under the prior formula if the prior formula provides a greater benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention Plan benefits are subject to forfeiture and rescission if an executive is terminated for cause or engages in competitive or other activity detrimental to IBM during or following employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions: 1995 Retention Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided under the Retention Plan for Dr. Kelly are determined under the Retention Plan formula in effect prior to the July 1, 1999 amendment (1995 Retention Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are available under the 1995 Retention Plan only if a participant terminates employment, becomes disabled or dies on or after meeting the early retirement age and service, holds an executive-level position immediately prior to termination or death, and has final average pay of at least $160,000 immediately prior to termination, disability or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit provided under the 1995 Retention Plan is payable only as an annuity beginning on the first day of the month following termination of employment (subject to a six-month delay for specified employees as required under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant terminates employment on or after age 60, the 1995 Retention Plan benefit expressed as an annual single life annuity is equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant terminates employment before age 60, the annual single life annuity resulting from the sum of the amounts specified in (1) through (4) is reduced as specified in the Retention Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if a participant terminates at age 59, the benefit is reduced by 3%, at age 58, by 7%, and at age 57, by 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit of a participant in the 1995 Retention Plan will not be less than the benefit that would be provided if the participant were in the 1999 Retention Plan, as described in the next subsection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions: 1999 Retention Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided under the Retention Plan to Mrs. Rometty are determined under the Retention Plan formula in effect on and after the July 1, 1999 amendment (1999 Retention Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are available under the 1999 Retention Plan if a participant holds an executive-level position immediately prior to termination or death, has final average pay in excess of $405,400 on both January 1, 2007 and immediately prior to termination or death, and either:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Terminates employment for any reason other than cause or dies, in each case after attaining age 55 and completing at least 15 years of service and either becomes disabled (as determined under IBMs long-term disability plan), or if approved by the Board in the case of the two highest paid officers (and if approved by the Compensation Committee and the chairman and chief executive officer in the case of any other officer of IBM).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant terminates employment after attaining age 60 and completing at least five years of service, the 1999 Retention Plan benefit expressed as an annual single life annuity is equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who terminates employment after attaining age 55, but prior to attaining age 60, who completes at least 15 years of service, and who receives Compensation Committee and chairman and chief executive officer approval (or Board approval in the case of the two highest paid officers) as described above, will receive a reduced single life annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reduced single life annuity will be determined by reducing the sum of the amounts specified in (1) and (2) by 0.5% for each month that the benefit commencement date precedes age 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements Included in Calculations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The definitions of eligible final average pay and eligible compensation for purposes of the Retention Plan have the same meanings as under the Pension Credit Formula in the IBM Personal Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retention Plan is unfunded and maintained as a book reserve (notional) account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No funds are set aside in a trust or otherwise; participants in the Retention Plan are general unsecured creditors of IBM regarding the payment of their Retention Plan benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Extra Years of Credited Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a participants years of credited service for benefits are based on the years an employee participated in the IBM Personal Pension Plan through December 31, 2007, the date accrual of future benefits stopped.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Available Forms of Payment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants benefit is only payable in the form of an annuity with monthly benefit payments beginning on the first day of the month following termination of employment (subject to a six-month delay for specified employees as required under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lump sum payments are not available under the Retention Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may elect to receive his or her benefit in the form of a single life annuity or in certain other actuarially equivalent forms of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 PENSION BENEFITS NARRATIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Pension Benefits Tables show the number of years of credited service, present value of accumulated benefit and payments during the last fiscal year for each eligible named executive officer under the IBM U.S. defined benefit pension plan and the IBM Germany Vorsorgeplan, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Rometty, Mr. Schroeter and Dr. Kelly have pension benefits under the U.S. defined benefit pension plan; Mr. Jetter has a pension benefit under the IBM Germany Vorsorgeplan, a defined benefit pension plan, and Mr. Clementi does not have a benefit under any IBM defined benefit pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Qualified Plan and Nonqualified Plan Descriptions  General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IBM Personal Pension Plan consists of a tax-qualified plan and a non-tax qualified plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2008, the non-tax qualified plan was renamed the IBM Excess Personal Pension Plan and is referred to herein as the Nonqualified Plan, and the tax- qualified plan is referred to as the Qualified Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combined plan is referred to herein as the IBM Personal Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2005, the IBM Personal Pension Plan was closed to new participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Description
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective July 1, 1999, IBM amended the IBM Personal Pension Plan to provide a new benefit formula, but allowed participants who met certain age and service conditions as of June 30, 1999, to elect to continue to earn benefits under the prior formulas, including the Pension Credit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Qualified Plan provides funded, tax-qualified benefits up to the limits on compensation and benefits under the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nonqualified Plan provides unfunded, nonqualified benefits in excess of the limits on compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM U.S. Personal Pension Plan (Qualified Plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose of the Qualified Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Qualified Plan was designed to provide tax-qualified pension benefits that are generally available to all U.S. regular employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cessation of accruals under the Qualified Plan and the continued IBM contributions under the tax-qualified defined contribution plan, the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan, reflects IBMs desire to provide appropriate benefits for its employees, consistent with the changing needs of IBMs workforce and the changing nature of retirement benefits provided by IBMs current competition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions: Pension Credit Formula under the Qualified Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Credit Formula is a pension equity formula that provides annual benefits based on a participants total point value divided by an annuity conversion factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annuity conversion factor is pre-determined according to the IBM Personal Pension Plan document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2008, participants earned points as follows: 0.16 base points each year until a 4.25 base point cap was reached, and 0.03 excess points each year until a 0.75 excess point cap was reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total point value is converted to an annuity at the benefit commencement date based on pre-determined annuity conversion factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may receive his or her benefit immediately following termination of employment, or may defer benefit payments unti any time between early retirement age and normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early retirement age is defined as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any age with 30 years of service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age 55 with 15 years of service; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Pension Credit Formula, a participant who terminates employment and whose pension benefit commences before his or her normal retirement age will receive smaller monthly annuity payments than if his or her benefit commences at normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead of receiving his or her entire benefit under the Pension Credit Formula as an annuity, a participant may elect to receive a portion of the benefit as an unsubsidized lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lump sum amount is based on the benefit the participant earned before January 1, 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions: Personal Pension Account Formula under the Qualified Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schroeters and Dr. Kellys benefit under the Qualified Plan is determined under the Personal Pension Account formula, which is a cash balance formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the terms of the Qualified Plan, under the Personal Pension Account formula prior to 2008, the eligible named executive officers above receive pay credits and interest credits to their respective Personal Pension Accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pay credits for a year were equal to 5% of the eligible named executive officers eligible compensation for that year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interest credits are based on the annual interest rate on one-year Treasury Constant Maturities plus 1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: eligible named executive officers may receive their benefit under the Personal Pension Account formula at any time following termination of employment, but may not defer the commencement of the benefit later than normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the eligible named executive officers benefit begins to be paid before normal retirement age, it will be reduced when compared to the benefit that would commence at normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The eligible named executive officers may receive their benefit in the following forms: a lump sum equal to the Personal Pension Account balance, an annuity that is actuarially equivalent to the Personal Pension Account balance, or both a partial lump sum and a reduced annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements Included in Calculations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2008, eligible compensation was generally equal to the total amount that is included in income including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recurring payments under any form of variable compensation plan (excluding stock options and other equity awards); and        Amounts deducted from salary and variable compensation under IBMs Internal Revenue Code Section 125 plan (cafeteria plan), and amounts deferred under IBMs 401(k) Plus Plan and Excess 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation  stock options, RSUs, RRSUs and PSUs  was excluded from eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for a year was limited to the compensation limit under the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2007, the last year that benefits accrued under the Qualified Plan, the compensation limit was $225,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, benefits provided under the Qualified Plan may not exceed an annual benefit limit under the Internal Revenue Code (which in 2016 was $215,000 payable as an annual single life annuity beginning at normal retirement age).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualified Plan Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the Qualified Plan are funded by an irrevocable tax-exempt trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants benefits under the Qualified Plan are payable from the assets held by the tax-exempt trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Extra Years of Credited Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, a participants years of credited service are based on the years an employee participates in the Qualified Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The years of credited service for the eligible named executive officers are based only on their service while eligible for participation in the Qualified Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2005, Mr. Schroeter left IBM U.S. and became an executive of IBM Australia, and therefore, Mr. Schroeters years of credited service for benefit calculations in the 2016 Pension Benefits Table are based only on his service with IBM U.S.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM U.S. Excess Personal Pension Plan (Nonqualified Plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Purpose of the Nonqualified Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nonqualified Plan provides Qualified Plan participants with benefits that may not be provided under the Qualified Plan because of the tax limits on eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit provided to a participant is payable following a separation from service from IBM (subject to the six-month delay for specified employees as required under Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions of the Nonqualified Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nonqualified Plan provides a benefit that is equal to the benefit that would be provided under the Qualified Plan if the compensation and benefit limits did not apply minus the benefit actually provided under the Qualified Plan disregarding the benefit limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Plan Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nonqualified Plan is unfunded and maintained as a book reserve (notional) account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No funds are set aside in a trust or otherwise; participants in the Nonqualified Plan are general unsecured creditors of IBM with respect to the payment of their Nonqualified Plan benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Extra Years of Credited Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The years of credited service for the eligible named executive officers are based only on their service while eligible for participation in the Qualified Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM Germany Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Description
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetter was an employee of IBM Germany through January 31, 2015 and was a participant in the APP defined benefit pension plan which was closed to new hires in 1992.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits for all participants continue to accrue under this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the closure of all remaining open defined benefit plans to new hires in 2010, IBM Germany offered all APP participants the option to convert their individual pension plans into the IBM Vorsorgeplan (IVP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the conversion, vested defined benefit pension rights under the APP were frozen, and all new pension entitlements were earned as cash balance entitlement (accumulation account).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material Terms and Conditions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetter accepted the conversion and became a participant in the IVP, and therefore he has two entitlements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the monthly pension according to the closed APP defined benefit plan earned through December 31, 2009 (the date of the conversion) (Prior Benefit); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the new cash entitlements earned since 2010 through January 31, 2015 under the IVP (New Benefit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters Prior Benefit is calculated using creditable compensation and service as of December 31, 2008 and shall be increased as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)      Achievable pension  which is calculated based on years of service up to age 62 and creditable salary as of December 12, 2008;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)      Vested pension  vested part of the achievable pension is calculated by multiplying the achievable pension by the ratio where the numerator is the years of service up to the conversion and the denominator is the employees years of service until the employee has reached age 62; plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)      Growing vested pension  the portion of the benefit that continues to increase until a pensionable event occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increase is determined based on individual salaries up to the relevant key date as compared to December 12, 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters New Benefit is comprised of IBM Germany contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As long as the participant has not terminated employment from IBM Germany, IBM Germany provides a contribution on December 31 each year until the participant turns 67, and a prorated contribution if a participant terminates prior to December 31.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Jetter, the IBM Germany contribution was 33.55 % per year times the total sum of his monthly pensionable earnings during the calendar year (which is 110% of Mr. Jetters monthly gross earnings).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Mr. Jetter separated from IBM Germany in January 2015, he received a prorated contribution in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The contributions earn a guaranteed return rate of 3.5% while the participant is employed, up to age 67.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, interest was credited annually through December 31, 2014 (0.75% from January 1, 2010 to December 31, 2012, and 0.25% from January 1, 2013 to December 31, 2014, after that 0.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Jetter, who participated in APP and who converted to the IVP in 2010, the annual interest rate is a minimum of .75%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of the Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant is entitled to a benefit if:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)      he terminates employment at age 67 (retirement pension);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)      he terminates employment after age 60 but prior to age 67 (early retirement pension)  between 60 and 62 with deductions; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)       he terminates employment prior to age 67 and receives a full and indefinite disability pension from the statutory pension insurance or a similar institution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Prior Benefit and the New Benefit have different payment rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Prior Benefit
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Prior Benefit is paid as an annuity, paid monthly and generally starts the month following the month in which the pensionable event has occurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, at retirement, Mr. Jetter can elect to have the entire Prior Benefit paid as a lump sum payment or as eight installment payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of New Benefit
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The New Benefit is paid in eight annual installments, each installment is increased by 3.5% after 12 months in each case from the date of the pensionable event up to the due date of the relevant installment (prorated if less than 12 months).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first installment is due and payable at the end of the fourth calendar month after the date on which the pensionable event has occurred and all following installments will occur that time each year thereafter for seven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, at retirement, Mr. Jetter can elect to have the entire New Benefit paid in a lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements Included in Calculations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible compensation for the Prior Benefit is the total amount of salary and recurring payments under any form of variable compensation plan, including annual incentive program payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible compensation for the New Benefit is the total amount of salary earned while eligible for contributions into the New Benefi under IVP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation  stock options, RSUs, RRSUs and PSUs  was excluded from eligible compensation for both the Prior Benefit and New Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters benefit is funded in part by an irrevocable contractual trust to which IBM Germany makes contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remainder of his benefit under IVP is a direct promise to pay, which is unfunded, but is reinsured by the IBM Deutschland Pensionskasse VVaG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Extra Years of Credited Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters years of credited service under IVP are based only on his service as an IBM Germany employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters Prior Benefit only counts pay and service through December 31, 2008 and his New Benefit counts pay from January 1, 2010 through January 31, 2015, the date Mr. Jetters employment with IBM Germany ended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION NARRATIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM Excess 401(k) Plus Plan  U.S.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Description and Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2008, the IBM Executive Deferred Compensation Plan (EDCP) was amended and renamed the IBM Excess 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM employees, including the named executive officers, who are eligible to participate in the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan and whose eligible pay is expected to exceed the Internal Revenue Code compensation limit for the applicable plan year are eligible to participate in the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan is to provide employees with the opportunity to save for retirement on a tax-deferred basis and provide benefits that would be provided under the qualified IBM 401(k) Plus Plan if the compensation limits did not apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table shows the employee deferrals (executive contributions), IBM match (registrant contributions), automatic contributions (registrant contributions), discretionary awards (registrant contributions) and investment gain or loss (aggregate earnings) for each named executive officer during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table also shows the total balance that each named executive officer has accumulated over all the years he or she has participated in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Account balances in the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan are comprised of cash amounts that were deferred by the participant or contributed by IBM (Basic Account), and all deferred shares, comprised of shares that were deferred by the participant (Deferred IBM Shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, amounts deferred and vested prior to January 1, 2005 are not subject to Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code, while amounts deferred and vested on and after January 1, 2005 are subject to Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Excess 401(k) Plus Plan allows the clawback of IBM matching and automatic contributions made to a participants account after March 31, 2010, if a participant engages in activity that is detrimental to IBM (including but not limited to competitive business activity, disclosure of confidential IBM information and solicitation of IBM clients or employees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Eligible for Deferral under Excess 401(k) Plus Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An eligible employee may elect to defer up to 80% of salary and eligible performance pay, which includes annual incentive program payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In both cases, the Internal Revenue Code requires the deferral elections to be made before the calendar year in which the compensation is earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred IBM Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to January 1, 2008, under the EDCP, any executive, including non-U.S. executives, could have elected to defer receipt of shares of IBM stock that otherwise would be paid as a result of the vesting of certain restricted stock unit awards granted on or before December 31, 2007 under IBMs Long-Term Performance Plan (LTPP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such deferral occurred when the awards vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with Internal Revenue Service rules, an executive could have also elected to defer receipt of shares of IBM stock that otherwise would be paid on or before February 1, 2008 as a result of the vesting of Performance Share Unit (PSU) awards under IBMs LTPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no outstanding deferral elections that would result in the deferral of stock in 2016, or thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents on Deferred IBM Shares are paid in cash at the same rate and on the same date as the dividends paid to IBM stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excess 401(k) Plus Plan Funding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Excess 401(k) Plus Plan is unfunded and maintained as a book reserve (notional) account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No funds are set aside in a trust or otherwise; participants in the plan are general unsecured creditors of IBM for payment of their Excess 401(k) Plus Plan accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM Matching Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM credits matching contributions to the Basic Account of each eligible participant who defers salary or eligible performance pay under the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The matching contributions equal the percentage of the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the amount the participant elects to defer under the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the participants eligible compensation after reaching the Internal Revenue Code compensation limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum matching contribution percentage for a participant is the same as the participants percentage under the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, participants hired or rehired by IBM U.S. before January 1, 2005, are eligible for up to 6% matching contributions; generally, participants hired or rehired by IBM U.S. on or after January 1, 2005 and who complete one year of service, are eligible for up to 5% matching contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mrs. Rometty and Dr. Kelly are eligible for a 6% matching contribution and Messrs. Schroeter, Jetter and Clementi are eligible for a 5% matching contribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2016, the matching contributions equal the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a participants match rate times the amount the participant elects to defer under the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the participants match rate times the eligible compensation after reaching the Internal Revenue Code compensation limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM Automatic Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2008, IBM credits automatic contributions to the Basic Account of each eligible participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The automatic contributions equal a percentage of the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the amount the participant elects to defer under the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the participants eligible compensation after reaching the Internal Revenue Code compensation limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The automatic contribution percentage for a participant is the participants automatic contribution percentage under the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the percentage is 2% or 4% if the participant was hired or rehired by IBM U.S. before January 1, 2005 (depending on the participants pension plan eligibility on December 31, 2007), or 1% if the participant was hired or rehired by IBM U.S. on or after January 1, 2005 and completes one year of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of calculating the automatic contributions under the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan, the participants eligible pay excludes the amount the participant elects to defer under the Excess 401(k) Plus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The automatic contribution percentage is 4% for Mrs. Rometty; 2% for Dr. Kelly; and 1% for each of Messrs. Schroeter, Jetter and Clementi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matching contributions and automatic contributions are made once annually at the end of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to receive such IBM contributions each year, a participant must have completed the service requirement, and must be employed on December 15 of the plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if a participant separates from service (including going on long-term disability) prior to December 15, and the participant has:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least 30 years of service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least 15 years of service and is at least age 55;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least 5 years of service and is at least age 62; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least 1 year of service and is at least age 65;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or, effective July 1, 2016, if a participant dies prior to December 15 in a given year, then the participant will be eligible to receive such IBM contributions as soon as practicable following separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective for the period of January 1, 2008 through June 30, 2009, IBM credited transition credits to an eligible participants Basic Account for those employees who were receiving transition credits in their Personal Pension Account under the Qualified Plan as of December 31, 2007.

sentences.text: According to the terms of the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan, Dr. Kelly was eligible to receive transition credits.

sentences.text: A participant may change the investment selections for new payroll deferrals as frequently as each semi-monthly pay cycle and may change investment selections for existing account balances daily, subject to excessive trading restrictions.

sentences.text: Payouts, Withdrawals and Other Distributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payouts, withdrawals or other distributions from the Basic Account are permitted prior to a separation from service from IBM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At termination, the balance in an eligible executives Basic Account that was deferred prior to January 1, 2005 is paid to the executive in an immediate lump sum unless:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the balance exceeds $25,000 and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the executive satisfies the following age and service criteria: At least age 55 with 15 years of service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least age 55 with 15 years of service        At least age 62 with 5 years of service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any age with at least 30 years of service, provided that, as of June 30, 1999, the executive had at least 25 years of service or was at least age 40 with 10 years of service; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant has satisfied the age, service and account balance criteria at termination, but has not made a valid advance election of another form of distribution, the amount of the participants Basic Account that was deferred prior to January 1, 2005 is paid in a lump sum in February of the year following separation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant has satisfied the age, service and account balance criteria at termination and has made a valid advance election, the amount of the participants Basic Account that was deferred prior to January 1, 2005 is paid as elected by the participant from among the following choices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.Lump sum in February of the year following termination; or 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual installments (beginning February 1 of the year following termination) for a number of years (between two and ten) elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participants Basic Account with respect to amounts deferred on or after January 1, 2005 may be distributed in the following forms as elected by the participant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual installments (beginning February 1 of the year following separation) for a number of years (between two and ten) elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the participant has elected annual installments and the total balance of the participants Basic Account upon a separation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: from service from IBM is less than 50% of the applicable Internal Revenue Code compensation limit (in 2016, 50% of this limit was $132,500), the amounts deferred on or after January 1, 2005 are distributed in a lump sum on the date installments would have otherwise begun.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution elections may be changed in advance of separation, in accordance with Internal Revenue Code rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution elections apply to both the Basic Account and the Deferred Shares Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, within the Basic Account and the Deferred Shares Account, different distribution elections are permitted to be made for the amounts that were deferred before January 1, 2005 and the amounts that were deferred on or after January 1, 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetter  immediate lump sum for all amounts

sentences.text: Dr. Kelly  lump sum in February of the year following separation for pre-2005 amounts, and 10 annual installments for post- 2004 amounts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Clementi  10 annual installments for all amounts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred IBM Shares are distributed only in the form of shares of IBMs common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These distribution rules are subject to Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code, including, for example, the rule that a specified employee may not receive a distribution of post-2004 deferrals until at least six months following a separation from service from IBM.

sentences.text: All named executive officers, were specified employees under Section 409A at the end of the last fiscal year.

sentences.text: IBM Italy Pension Fund
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Description
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Clementi was an employee of IBM Italy prior to his U.S. employment, which commenced January 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While an employee of IBM Italy and an Italian citizen, Mr. Clementi is eligible for a pension under the social security system as required by law, and sponsored by the Italian government.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM made legally required contributions to the social security system (INPS) on behalf of Mr. Clementi through December 31, 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to contributions to INPS, IBM Italy offers a supplementary plan, Fondo Pensione Dirigenti IBM (the Supplementary Plan) to its executive population, which provides additional pension benefits that exceed those provided by the social security system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplementary Plan is a separate qualified legal entity under Italian law and is a defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, all executives employed by IBM Italy are eligible to participate in the Supplementary Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation is voluntary, and an executive must elect to participate in the Supplementary Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Eligible for Deferral into the Supplementary Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible executives can choose to participate in the Supplementary Plan in two ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) by irrevocably transferring severance pay legally required to be set aside; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) making contributions that are based on the participants pay (ranges from 2.5% for pay up to 46,123 to 7.3% for pay over 87,633).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may also elect to make further voluntary monthly contributions to the Supplementary Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employer Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all participants, IBM Italy makes contributions to the Supplementary Plan on a monthly basis equal to a set amount that varies based on salary (2.5% to 5.48% of salary); provided that the employer contribution does not exceed 5.5% of the entire gross pay and that it is not less than the amount established under the applicable collective agreement (4,800).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings Measures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants choose to invest their account in one of three investment alternatives: the Insurance Fund, the Bond Securities Fund or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Share Fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The default alternative is the Insurance Fund, which guarantees a minimum percentage return on capital depending on operating results (currently 2.0% annually calculated on the paid, consolidated capital as of January 1, 2013).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may change their investment election for new contributions at any time, and may change their allocations among the investment alternatives once each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bond Securities Fund and the Share Fund do not provide any guaranteed return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 annual rates of return for the three investment options are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insurance Fund (2.79%)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts, Withdrawals and Other Distributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are eligible (but are not required) to take a distribution after reaching pensionable age as set forth under law and have participated in the Supplementary Plan for at least five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may receive their benefit as an annuity or as a combination of an annuity and partial lump sum payment  which lum sum payment shall not exceed 50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to his hire date, Mr. Clementi may choose to take his entire benefit in a lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution elections are made at the time of retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any annuities paid from the Supplementary Plan are calculated in accordance with the Supplementary Plan regulations for converting plan accounts to annuities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant dies before accessing the benefits, the individuals heirs or designated beneficiaries shall receive his account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant can request an advance of his account under the following circumstances:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) at any time, up to 75%, to cover health care costs in the event of a serious illness affecting the participant or his spouse or dependents;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) up to 75% for the purchase of his, or his childrens, primary residence or for maintenance to the residence, once a participant has participated for at least eight years; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) up to a maximum of 30% for other purposes, once a participant has participated for at least eight years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 POTENTIAL PAYMENTS UPON TERMINATION NARRATIVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM does not have any plans, programs or agreements under which payments to any of the named executive officers are triggered by a change of control of IBM, a change in the named executive officers responsibilities or a constructive termination of the named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only payments or benefits that would be provided by IBM to a named executive officer following a termination of employment would be provided under the terms of IBMs existing compensation and benefit programs (as described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Messrs. Jetter and Clementi will be eligible for a payment upon termination pursuant to their IBM U.S. offer letters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments represent a one-time replacement payment to compensate Messrs. Jetter and Clementi for the retirement benefits that they would have continued to earn as employees of IBM Germany and IBM Italy, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jetters payment equals the difference between
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the amount of the benefit he would have accumulated, but not yet earned under the IBM Vorsorgeplan (IVP) had he remained an employee of IBM Germany, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the maximum amount of IBM matching and automatic contributions he is eligible to receive under the IBM 401(k) Plus Plan and the IBM Excess 401(k) Plus Plan (US Plans) regardless of whether he participates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts shall be calculated from February 1, 2015 to the date that Mr. Jetter separates from service with IBM, and in accordance with the terms and conditions of the IVP and the US Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment shall be made in a lump sum in the February following the year of separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mr. Jetter dies or becomes disabled, the payment shall be made 90 days after such death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to become eligible for a payment under his offer letter, Mr. Clementi had to complete five years of service following January 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After completing such service Mr. Clementis payment is equal to $500,000, plus, for each year that Mr. Clementi works beyond January 1, 2014, the amount payable is increased by 10% for a maximum period of five years (through January 1, 2019).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee hereby reports as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including the system of internal accounting controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, in its oversight role, has reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements with IBMs management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with IBMs internal auditors and IBMs independent registered public accounting firm the overall scope of, and plans for, their respective audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has met with the internal auditors and independent registered public accounting firm, separately and together, with and without management present, to discuss IBMs financial reporting process and internal accounting controls in addition to other matters required to be discussed by the statement on Auditing Standards No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees, as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB), as may be modified or supplemented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding PwCs communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with PwC its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has an established charter outlining the practices it follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is available on IBMs website at: http://www.ibm.com/investor/governance/audit-committee-charter.html.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBMs Audit Committee has policies and procedures that require the pre-approval by the Audit Committee of all fees paid to, and all services performed by, IBMs independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of each year, the Audit Committee approves the proposed services, including the nature, type and scope of service contemplated and the related fees, to be rendered by the firm during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, pursuant to authority delegated by the Audit Committee, the Audit Committee chair may approve engagements that are outside the scope of the services and fees approved by the Audit Committee which are later presented to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each category of proposed service, the independent registered public accounting firm is required to confirm that the provision of such services does not impair its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the fees and services provided as noted in the table below were authorized and approved by the Audit Committee in compliance with the pre-approval policies and procedures described herein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to in paragraphs (1) through (5) above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors of IBM, and the Board has approved, that the audited financial statements be included in IBMs Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees: comprise fees for professional services necessary to perform an audit or review in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, including services rendered for the audit of IBMs annual financial statements (including services incurred with rendering an opinion under Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002) and review of quarterly financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also includes fees for services that are normally incurred in connection with statutory and regulatory filings or engagements, such as comfort letters, statutory audits, attest services, consents, and review of documents filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, these services included approximately $13 million for the auditing of financial statements for a wholly-owned subsidiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees: comprise fees for services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of IBMs financial statements, including the support of business acquisition and divestiture activities, independent assessments for service organization control reports and audit and review of IBMs retirement and other benefit-related programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, these services included approximately $18 million for independent assessments for service organization control reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2015, these services included approximately $17 million for independent assessments for service organization control reports and approximately $9 million for services in support of acquisition and divestiture activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees: comprise fees for tax compliance, tax planning and tax advice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate tax services encompass a variety of permissible services, including technical tax advice related to U.S. international tax matters; assistance with foreign income and withholding tax matters, assistance with sales tax, value added tax and equivalent tax related matters in local jurisdictions; preparation of reports to comply with local tax authority transfer pricing documentation requirements; and assistance with tax audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Fees: comprise fees primarily in connection with certain benchmarking work and permissible advisory services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As disclosed in its charter, the Audit Committee is responsible for selecting IBMs independent registered public accounting firm, reviewing that selection with the Board of Directors, approving all related fees and compensation for the accounting firm, and overseeing the work of the firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with its charter, the Audit Committee has selected the firm of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC), an independent registered public accounting firm, to be IBMs auditors for the year 2017, and with the endorsement of the Board of Directors believes that this selection is in the best interests of IBM and its stockholders and therefore recommends to stockholders that they ratify that appointment.

sentences.text: PwC served in this capacity for the year 2016.

sentences.text: PwCs representative will be present at the Annual Meeting and will have an opportunity to make a statement and be available to respond to appropriate questions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each category of proposed service, PwC is required to confirm that the provision of such services does not impair its independence.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included a review of its performance in prior years, as well as its reputation for integrity and competence in the fields of accounting and auditing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has expressed its satisfaction with PwC in all of these respects.

sentences.text: 3. MANAGEMENT PROPOSAL ON ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BM is asking that you APPROVE the compensation of the named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, IBM emerged as the recognized cognitive solutions and cloud platform company  the result of a multi-year transformation of the business portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IBM reinvented its core hardware, software, and services franchises, while investing to create new ones such as IBM Cloud, IBM Analytics, IBM Security, and the Watson businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A strong foundation is now in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific highlights of performance include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated revenue of $79.9 billion and GAAP net income from continuing operations of $11.9 billion (operating non-GAAP net income of $13.0 billion).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered GAAP gross margin of 48%, reflecting the investments made in acquisitions and our as-a-Service business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved GAAP diluted earnings per share from continuing operations of $12.39 (operating non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $13.59).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated $17.0 billion in cash from operations and $11.6 billion in free cash flow, with a strong realization rate of 97% of GAAP net income, while continuing our investment in research & development and capital expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scaled Strategic Imperatives  cloud, analytics, mobile, security and social  up 13% year over year and contributing 41% of IBMs revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue from analytics increased 9% and mobile, security and social collectively increased 19%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued momentum in our high-value businesses, providing world-class innovation to our clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Software Solutions grew 5%, Technology Services and Cloud Platforms grew 1% and our total Software revenue was flat at actual rates, returning to growth at constant currency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: momentum of its strategic direction as well as the Boards desire to ensure her continued service through a critical period in IBMs multi-year transformation, align her compensation closely with increases in shareholder value over the long-term, and, when combined with her ongoing compensation, deliver a market-competitive performance-based total compensation opportunity.

sentences.text: While one-time stock grants are prevalent in our industry for leaders navigating companies through extraordinary periods of transformation, this grant is unique in several ways.
